lead_paragraph: GEIGER--Melissa Brown Wiley, died of natural causes in New York City on Saturday, December 19, 2015 surrounded by her loving family. Born in Bay Shore, NY in 1937, she was the oldest child of Melissa Adams and Robert Hoffman Wiley. Melissa graduated from Spring Valley High School, Spring Valley, NY in 1955. She attended Skidmore College and married in 1957. Howard and Melissa began their marriage at Dartmouth College. Howard's career brought them to many places: Munich, Germany; New Jersey; Minneapolis; San Francisco and finally settling down in Manhattan in 1987. Their lifelong home was on Lake George in Putnam, NY. Melissa brought music and friendship wherever she went; these passions defined her life. An extremely talented pianist, she played the organ for her church beginning at age 12. Melissa played an active role in her children's education, always volunteering, often as the accompanist for school musical productions. She sang in the Plymouth Church Choir and with the Plymouth Music Series. She supported the Minnesota Opera. Melissa was the Minister of Music, Organist and Choir Director at Suffern Presbyterian Church in Suffern, NY. While living in San Francisco, she sang in the Unitarian Church Choir and was a board member of The San Francisco Chamber Singers, now called Volti. In Manhattan, she joined the music department of the Rudolf Steiner School as a faculty member and retired in 2002. Melissa joined The Riverside Church in 1988 committed to making our world a better place through music. She was a member of The Riverside Choir, the Riverside Choral Society, served as Music Committee chair, raised funds for the Men's Shelter and was actively involved in the founding of the Catherine Van Buren Endowment Fund and the Friends of Music. She most recently enjoyed spending time with her children, grandchildren, friends, and her dog. Melissa is survived by her children, Melissa Ann Geiger (Paul Marvin) of New York, NY, Kirsten Geiger Rider (Harold) of Winnetka, IL, Howard (Skip) Wilton Geiger III of New York, NY, Christopher Wiley Geiger of Larkspur, CA and her brother, William Adams Wiley (Lynn) of Grantham, NH; nine grandchildren, Paul and Oliver Marvin of New York, NY, Harold, Sarah and Christopher Rider of Winnetka, IL, Lillian Geiger of New York, NY, Wiley, Bourke and Finley Geiger of Larkspur, CA as well as many adored nieces, nephews and her beloved dog Libee. Her husband of 56 years, Howard Wilton and her brother, George Martin Wiley III, predeceased Melissa. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to Friends of Music, The Riverside Church, 490 Riverside Drive, New York, NY, 10027. Services will be held at The Riverside Church, 490 Riverside Drive, New York, NY at 12:00pm on Monday, January 4. A memorial reception will immediately follow. There will be additional opportunities to meet with family and friends. 1/3
